title: Nashville actress Hayden Panettiere enters treatment for postnatal depression
text:
Nashville actress Hayden Panettiere enters treatment for postnatal depression Nashville actress Hayden Panettiere enters treatment for postnatal depression Share 
Actress Hayden Panettiere is entering treatment for postnatal depression. 
A spokeswoman said in a statement that the Nashville star is voluntarily seeking professional help at a treatment centre while battling postpartum depression. She asked that the media respect her privacy during this time. 
Hayden gave birth to her daughter Kaya in December 2014, the first child for the 26-year-old actress and her fiance 39-year-old professional boxer Wladimir Klitschko. (Katy Winn/AP) 
The actress is best know for playing cheerleader Claire Bennet in the NBC science fiction series Heroes and for her role in the film Scream 4. 
Hayden’s Nashville character Juliette Barnes is also battling PPD onscreen. 
According to Mail Online, the actress said she “related” to her character when she appeared on Live! With Kelly and Michael last month. 
“It’s something a lot of women experience,” she said. “When [you are told] about postpartum depression, you think it’s ‘I feel negative feelings towards my child; I want to injure or hurt my child’. 
But, she explained: “I’ve never, ever had those feelings. Some women do, but you don’t realise how broad of a spectrum you can really experience that on. 
“It’s something that needs to be talked about. Women need to know that they’re not alone, and that it does heal.” 
In a recent tweet, Hayden suggested she was feeling better about life. Feeling like I'm #finally coming back in to my own body!mother #daughter #blessing #wellworthit @bonesthenskin pic.twitter.com/ZwUDyo4MhF Share article
